page_analysis.text_content:
What counts as floor area summary

Architectural feature

Porches & entry features
• Unenclosed porches
• Enclosed porches
• Entry feature ≤ 12' in height
• Entry feature > 12' in height
• 1st floor recessed porches < 10' in depth and open on exterior side
• 2nd floor roofed or enclosed porches, arcades, balconies, porticos, breezeways

Attics & equivalencies
• Attic space where floor to under side of roof rafter distance is < 5'
• All 2nd floor space (including attics) where head height or distance from top of floor to bottom of rafter is ≥ 5'
• 2nd floor equivalent: areas where height from top of first floor to top of roof material is > 17'
• 3rd floor equivalent: areas where height from top of first floor to top of roof material is > 26'
• Exemption: 3rd floor equivalent, where roof pitch is ≥ 4:12
• Exemption: Unusable attic space for Category 1 & 2 historic homes

Basements
• Basements that comply with patio & lightwell requirements of 18.12.070
• Basements of Category 1 & 2 historic homes or contributing structures in a historic district (even if > 3')

Other
• Bay windows (if ≥ 18" above interior flr, does not project > 2', and > 50% windows)
• Architectural appendages like fireplace or buttress footprint

Accessory structures
• Accessory structures > 120 sf
• Garages and carports
• Porte cocheres

visual_elements.description: A three-column table with headers 'Architectural feature', 'Counts?', and 'Illustration'. It lists various architectural features, whether they count towards floor area, and references to illustrations.
